Maybe Cristobal?

         A brilliant naga with a desire for science and mathematics. He came to Naga University to increase is prowess in medical science, but it later turned into something more. After meeting his cousin; Magdalena, hearing her tale of Loth bullying her with the morning after and his roommate; Malika's custom of eating people she likes to show her affection, he began to suspect that there was a part missed in the anatomy of both nagas and dridders. Loth has tried to tamper with his research as a joke (also because he spends his Sundays talking with her mother over a cup of tea, about their work (Loth's mother is self employed and successful, providing a much wanted intellectual conversation), only to get a scalpel thrown at her face (she's damn lucky he deliberately misses her, otherwise... She'd be another autopsy and dissection for his research). Sam is trying to be a part of his team for fame and money, only to be fleeing for her life every time from an angry Magdalena (who is chasing Sam with a bone saw and a syringe full of either morphine or clinical anesthesia (Sam is a trypanophobe (terrified of needles to the point of wetting the floor as she runs away), so Cristobal considers that as his daily dose of dark comedy)). Cristobal loves humans as people, and will often go out of his way to have a friendly conversation with one (often successful, when he's not the person is a racist or specesist)

         Cristobal has asked Yoko to be a control subject, as well as his assistant in his analyses. Yoko accepted but is unsure if she made a wise decision or not (as she rarely wants to be eaten, if at all). Despite the reward and the glory should this go right, the risk has left the young scientist with few candidates. He's hoping to find more willing 'clients' (he hates using the terms subjects, guinea pigs, or 'lab rats' as he feels it would be dehumanizing if he called his willing assistants such things (he also believes that the hybrids; naga and dridder, are human in at least some ways)). Dean Bo allows Cristobal to have naga and dridder corpses in his dorm room, as he is very neat and tidy (cleans up everything after a day's autopsy/dissection as if it never happened, and when he's done, he stitches the corpse up and sends it back to the morgue that he got it from). Very few know this, but Cristobal and Loth are distant cousins, separated after Loth's ancestor got in a serious fight with Cristobal's (Loth's ancestor; Alejandro, tried to frame and kill Cristobal's ancestor; Andre, for crimes he committed against the crown), sending Alejandro into exile overseas (he was spared execution by Andre's plea) while Andre was able to stay in Spain as an advisor to the king and queen (their ancestors were brothers. Loth and Cristobal don't know that, but their parents do! Should they know this, Loth and Cristobal's lives would be turned upside down and inside out). Cristobal is also spending his time as an engineer, a chemist, a physicist, surgeon and dreams of also being a neurosurgeon (with a dexterity that could rival all the greatest thieves in history combined, according to his medical professors, as well as a gentleness of a kitten). When not at school, he spends his time working at the coroner, determining cause of death and investigation of possible murder cases. He considers that a "hobby," and a community service. When not doing either, he works with a team of intellectual nagas, humans and dridders in an underground science team called "Wendigo" (Cristobal chose the Wendigo as their mascot, not because it's the malevolent spirit of the American cannibals, but because of it's adamant devotion; once you're in it's sights, it will not stop for ANYTHING until it has you right where it wants you). the team won an international science contest with the creation of a robot with a brain; an actual nervous system, with the culturing of brain cells, and spinal cord slices, both harvested by approval of the team, it is referred to as VLAD (after the original idea of a database that is able to hear and see; not to mention speak in more than fifteen languages (Video-Language-Audio-Database) this robot is self aware, and considered a team member, as it has parts of the brains of all the team members (one of them was a newcomer and Loth's cousin; Mikhaila, who came up with a design for a competitor in the Aqua-Bot Brawl in a couple months.) one of the teachers; Professor Stheno, is helping with the intricacies in their projects and experiments, as she was labelled among the top 25 smartest nagas in the world (for her work in creating a cure-all for any form of naga and dridder venom, as well as a way to rehabilitate humans, nagas and dridders who only have their top half without any severe consequences (Kurisu was her first success, and like him, she prefers to be low profile now). Professor Stheno is Cristobal's mentor, and close friend, so the two get along quite well, despite him beating her by a landslide in the contest. Stheno means "wrath" in ancient Greek, and like her name suggests, her meltdown are catastrophic. Asako has heard of her fury, and when hears of her, immediately changes the subject, unless it's about the Professor's advanced anatomy class. I've seen your actions; treating me like a toy, and throwing me away when you're done! HEARTS ARE NOT SOMETHING YOU CAN ABUSE AND GET BACK SO EASILY! DO YOU HONESTLY TAKE ME FOR AN IMBECILE?!?!" Amber was shocked at this anger, as she thought that her playfulness was not doing any harm to anyone. "Kurisu... I know that you're going through a tough breakup. but please! Hear me out! I lo-" Kurisu was done with her. "JUST LEAVE ME ALONE! YOU'VE DONE ENOUGH ALREADY!" Amber bolted out of the door, sobbing. However, Kurisu was not moved by these tears. All he did was sigh, as his work was done. Turning his desk light on, he looked for his journal, as this day was easily worth a page.
         He found it, finally; a tome covered in religious symbols, and on the cover, a pentagram of crosses and crescent moons. On the tome's cover; above the pentagram, it said "Diary of Shame: the Life of the First Cold-Blooded Human," after his life before the infamous accident. The tome contained everything about his life, from his sixth birthday, when he got the book, to yesterday, when he was orphaned and crippled by the serial killer, Azrael Iacabra (Better known to dridders and nagas as the infamous 'Mamba' or 'Widowmaker'). The strange thing was that him being cold-blooded and his DNA 87.5% naga, he was compatible with naga parts, which led to a miraculous surgery to save him. However, he was abused in this new form as he was in the past, only finding comfort in Sam. This was gone quickly, and his days were nothing but grief, as mentioned in the pages. Every one of the pages was written in an ink he mixed with his blood. This day was particularly dreadful, as he ended a long friendship, and broke another girl's heart afterwards. As he opened the cover a slip of paper fell from the inside. It was folded in three and sealed. Kurisu continued to write, mentioning his deep regret in making Amber cry, as he hates to see someone sad. As he finished the page, and the illustration of his thoughts, he closed the journal, sighed, and turned around. He wished to see his incubating egg, as it was almost ready to hatch. Putting his hand on the shell, he said "Sleep tight, my child. Soon you will be in my arms. And I swear I will protect you." he patted the egg gently, and closed the door. Kurisu noticed the paper, and picked it up. He saw it was a letter, bu what was in it made his jaw drop. Who sent the letter? And what was in it?
155311.title: Kurisu's New Beginning

15533.content:
how about a new human in the school?

like one of yoko's siblings.

155331.content: Yoko walked into the school. Her winter break had been really short. Nothing seemed out of the normal, exept that her younger _____, _____(15 years) was going to be joining her this semester.
155331.title: yeah

155332.content:
Or bring in another Naga. Named Salafeta

Or choose your own option
155332.title: More Options

1553321.content:
"Yoko you can wake up now. They're gone and classes are over." Called a calm female voice from all around Yoko. As Yoko finally woke from her rest inside one of the few Nagas that actually managed to control their hunger and tried to look out for humans like her. All around the warm tight and moist tail stomach squeezed and rubbed all of Yoko's body. To both keep her calm and wake her up from her short rest inside the Naga's stomach. A rare find as humans were always preyed upon by Nagas much like the one Yoko was inside of now.

Yoko awoke with a stir and moved around inside the others stomach. Moving around inside the female Nagas stomach, an idea Yoko would not normally be open to and even then still didn't like the idea of being inside another person’s stomach. However, she much rather be inside the stomach of a Naga that was willing to help her than a Naga that would trap her inside them forever.

And with a quick lifting, pulling sensation the Nagas stomach and throat muscles began expelling Yoko from within the Nagas belly. And in a manner of moments Yoko was once more out of the Nagas stomach and into the world. To continue the constant everyday test of avoiding being eaten and trapped forever. Yoko turned around and looked to the Naga that had helped her earlier with Yoko's problem of being hunted for by other Nagas of the school grounds that all seemed to want to make Yoko a meal.

As she turned to look to the Naga she saw the familiar upper half of a human, as the female Naga had shoulder length red hair that was currently tied back to short pony tail to keep the hair out of her face. And allowed Yoko to see those emerald green eyes that had slit like pupils just like a normal snake. Her light colored skin had a slight covering of freckles under those eyes and lightly covered her face. She wiped her mouth with a napkin from the little bit of extra saliva build up that came from tasting Yoko. As Yoko seemed to always caused every Naga, no matter how helpful or rude to think she was extremely tasty and Yoko knew that she always had to resist that urge to keep her down every time she tasted her. The Naga smiled to Yoko placing the napkin in a little trash can a sure sign as any that Yoko knew she was safe with this Naga, for now at least.

The rest of the Naga's upper body was hidden away by the customary white lab overcoat. That hid much of the Nagas lightly freckled arms and chest, meaning that she had to be inside one of the many labs on the campus still. At her waist was a simple belt that held two large pouches on its side and held the overcoat closed as well as a few other buttons, so that it covered her front. And from the waist down, despite the large white overcoat that hid her waist was the Nagas long snake like tail. It was covered in two different patterns, her top scale color patterns were colored exactly like a Coral Snake's going down the entire 40+ feet of tail in a constant pattern of Yellow Black Yellow Red Yellow. And the second pattern the one on the Nagas large underbelly scales were Red in the center and which tapered off into Yellow closer to the edges of the large bottom belly scales. And all 40+ feet of that long serpentine tail was coiled behind the Naga as she stood before Yoko and looked down to her as she was at least 8 feet tall.

"Thank you Salafeta." Yoko said looking up to her grateful for being able to once again avoid being turned into a stomach slave. Looking around the room Yoko noticed that they were in the Alchemy lab and were surrounded by all sorts of Alchemy equipment and ingredients and all sorts of items. All stacked on shelves stored away or on tables being turned into the next batch of whatever potions were being made in here.

"You’re welcome Yoko and please call me Sala. Between friends formalities of the class room don't need to exist, besides it's not like I'm going to eat you for not using my full name." Sala smiled licking her lip and moving the tip of her tail towards Yoko and lightly coiling around her. Though Yoko was quick to push Sala's tail away and laughed a little. They both knew that even though she would joke about eating her, she very well could and Yoko was quite powerless to stop her from doing so. Which was why Yoko was glad that Sala tried to always stick up for her and protect her from the other Nagas that tried to turn Yoko into their belly pet or stomach slave. Seeing how Yoko was incapable of being digested thanks to her own heritage of being what was called a 'Vore' among most of the world to describe people that could be eaten over and over without being digested. Which was another thing that made Yoko so highly desirable by other Nagas to get her inside them, as she could keep their stomach filled forever.

"Maybe not, but there's already enough Nagas trying to eat me that I'd rather not have another trying to gobble me up." Yoko sighed and walked over and ran a hand over Sala's tail. Touching her scales knowing how the large Naga liked it when others touched her tail. Even though she wouldn't openly tell a person about it or force another it was still something she took some measure of enjoyment from. As Sala for how kind she was was also a little vain, at least when it came to her tail.

"You know. One day you’re really going to have to take me up on my offer Yoko." Sala said looking to her and moving her tail away from Yoko happy she had pet her tail. "It's the one way to make sure that the others will stop hunting you and trying to eat you." Sala continued concerned for her human friend. "It only seems to be getting worse for you day by day. And I'd hate to see you disappear inside some Naga and be trapped inside them." She said as Yoko sighed and looked up to her from beside her.

"Sala you know you care about me, but I've already told you before how I feel about it." Yoko said looking up to her being serious about her feelings on the matter of what Sala's offer. "Besides it's not like you've not seen me be eaten before. And it is certainly not like you've all never gone out of your way to coil around the one that ate me to try and rescue me." Yoko smiled and light hit Sala's arm playfully as Sala smiled and nodded her head laughing a little remembering a few times she had to rescue Yoko from the belly of another Naga.

"I know, but still I'd rather not have to worry about you day by day. It's not good for the nerves. And considering how many I have inside me and my tail it's really not good." Sala laughed as she smiled to Yoko, but still wished she'd take her up on her offer. "You know I'm only going to keep asking you over and over, Yoko."

"I know you will. And I'll always know that you care for me each time you do." Yoko said squeezing her arm and smiled.
1553321.title: Out of the belly of a friend

15533211.content:
“So Sala how angry were they when they learned you had gotten to me before they did?” Yoko asked sitting on one of the tables as Sala went across the Alchemy lab to take care of some last minute things before she would walk Yoko home. A task, which Yoko said, she did not have to do yet Sala insisted that she would do. If for no other fact than Sala wanted to see her friend safely to her dorm room.

“Well, they weren’t happy. That much was certain.” Sala said as she moved around and mixed a few items into a container. Much of which Sala did was not certain to Yoko, but she knew that she was more than likely concocting something for her. Sala always tried to make something new and ask her to test out one of her new potions ideas. It was another of those quirks of hers that could be both a blessing as much as a nuisance. Yet she only did so out of love and wanting to try to make things easier for Yoko. Sala was anything if not caring for Yoko, maybe a little over protective on occasions such as this. Yet she could not really fault Sala, not without alienating the Naga and making her think she did not want her help anymore.

“Well I could have guessed that, but just how upset were they?” Yoko asked again trying to see just what she should be expecting tomorrow morning, when she had to come back and go to classes. With those that liked to cause Yoko no end of problems and had chased Yoko, forcing her to seek out Sala for help evading them.

“They said they would simply wait to get at you tomorrow. And a few threats and such is the normal.” She said casually wrapped up into her work. Another thing about Sala, once she got involved in something she normally dedicated all her time and attention to that particular thing. Much as she was doing now, with whatever she was doing with the items and potion she was making. Yet, it was that same dedication, that attention to detail, that placed Sala where she was at now, almost done with her time university and she only just entered her third year. Whereas Yoko was in her second, having met Sala sometime during her first year when she was looking for a place to hide and had done so by trying to hide in the Alchemy lab where Sala was currently working and doing her testing and creating of new potions.

“You’d think after all the kind warning’s and demonstrations of my own capabilities they’d think twice before threatening me, but I guess when one is really hungry they don’t think straight.” Sala continued and turned around from the table holding a small glass container and making her way back to Yoko.

“Here, try this for me will you please?” Sala asked holding out the small glass container to Yoko who looked at it speculatively, taking it slowly and cautiously, noting that the liquid was a strange brown coloring.

“What is it? Or rather what is this supposed to do?” Yoko asked looking up from the container to Sala.

“That is my latest in my line of ability enhancers.” She said with a smile and quickly her eyes went wide at the look in Yoko’s eyes. “Oh no! Not anything like those illegal enhancements, that are passed around the halls. This one is completely natural and is composed of school approved items and materials. In addition, the professor said if I can come up with a viable non-addictive and beneficial sample batch, he’d sign off on another of my license requirements to be a certified producer and distributer of basic items on the school grounds.” Sala smiled happily thinking of how she would be able to help her friend even more, if she could earn that license. As well as how she would be able to help, others that really needed that edge to survive the day by day.

Yoko looked to Sala a bit surprised and questioning just a little, but decided she would do this to help her friend. After all, she had helped her plenty of times in the past, this was just another way to pay her back and she knew how much Sala wanted that license and what it meant to her. So with a sigh Yoko closed her eyes and closed her nose and downed the brown liquid, shuddering slightly at the awful bitter taste to it.

“So, how is it?” Sala asked a bit expectantly biting her lower lip nervous.

“Well, it has an awfully bitter taste to it still. I thought you said you were going to work on correcting that with your potions, Sala?”

“I’m sorry about that. Here have some water,” Sala said handing Yoko a simple glass of water she had purified of any contaminants. As it was her belief that if the water was not as pure as could be, that the contaminants inside normal drinking water could have a negative effect on her potions, even though it had been proven that they did not. “So do you feel any different? Possibly faster or stronger or any change at all?” Sala asked after Yoko took the water and drank it.

“Not really, I still feel the same. Nothing is different really, other than a slight tingle in the back of my throat from it going down but that’s about it.” Yoko said shaking her head no. To which Sala sighed crossing her arms and rubbed her forehead as she tried to think where her potion might have failed.

“I don’t get it. Everything should have worked, all the studies said that components would work together.” Sala said turning around and slithering away from Yoko to look over her notes. More than a little bit put off from this set back.

Yoko felt bad for Sala and hopped off the table and onto the floor. Yet when she did so she landed far more softly than she would have normally almost as if something was off, but she just brushed it off as fatigue due to a long day. She walked over to Sala and placed a hand on her shoulder as Sala was hunched over a table looking at her notes, starring at them, reading them.

“Hey Sala, it’s getting late. Why don’t you give yourself a break and let’s go back to the dorms. I need to get some rest and assure my roommate I haven’t disappeared forever down Sam’s throat. Not to mention you need to get some rest yourself. I know how you get when you’re absorbed into your work, but taking a moment to step back and rest will do you better then remaining cooped up inside this building looking for something that you thought you missed.” Yoko said with a smile as Sala sighed and dipped her head. Than looked up and over to Yoko and smiled, leaning over she gave Yoko a light hug.

“Alright I’ll take a break. Thanks Yoko I guess I really do get wrapped up in my work too much.” Sala admitted and let go of Yoko and stood up to her full height as she stretched and grabbed her notes and put them away in a drawer with the rest of her studies.

“So, ready to head out then? I’ll buy you dinner if you’d like.” Sala offered returning to Yoko and heading to the door with her following beside her.

“I think I’d like that. Want to get some pizza Sala?” Yoko asked looking to Sala who blinked quickly and blushed as she nodded her head as she was hiding something.

“Yeah that would be a good idea. I could use some pizza.” Sala said looking a little distant as she led them both out of the university campus and to the nearby pizzeria at the edge of town close by. Yoko looked to Sala a bit worriedly she knew Sala was a good person, but she too was a Naga like the rest and it worried her when Sala acted like this. However, she trusted her so she would stay with her, but she would keep an eye on her friend, just in case.
15533211.title: The Alchemist and her Potions

155332111.content:
There were quite a few other Naga and Humans out in that evening some were actually talking to each other. While more than, a few Nagas seemed to follow or stalk a human every so often, but did so discreetly. Yet for the most part people went about their daily lives not worrying about being eaten or eating another. At least not out in the open as would normally happen on campus. Yoko earned more than a few stares from passing Nagas, but that only gave her even more reason to stay closer to Sala. It took them maybe half an hour to walk to town from campus and Yoko had to call her roommate and tell her she was all right that she would be back a little later and bring her something from the pizzeria.

The pizzeria itself was a rather small building and could probably fit about ten Nagas at most when busy. Luckily, the place was known for its quick service and great tasting pizza. In addition, the couple that owned and ran it were a human and Naga couple that enjoyed their work and talking with their customers and were generally on a first name basis with much of their regular customers. Which was just about anyone that went to the university, as well as a couple people from the city and it was always a tossup to exactly whom you would meet there. Yet luckily, there were not too many other Nagas from campus and none of them were those that had been looking for Yoko earlier. Of course, that did not mean they would not show up later or at some point to ruin the last hours of a rather enjoyable evening.

As Yoko and Sala got their own seats at a table, an older looking female Naga came over to their table wearing the normal shirt and skirt and blouse. Her blonde hair was loose and hung free and her blue eyes looked to both Sala and Yoko with a pad of paper and a pen.

“Hello there you two, welcome back what can I get you today? The usual?” Asked the female Naga Yania one of the owners of the pizzeria Mike the other owner normally took care of making the pizzas, but would also sneak out of the kitchen to talk to the customers as well every now and then.

“Yeah, two large peperoni pizzas and some tea would be great.” Sala said sounding half-starved as she answered the older Naga.

“I’d like some water if you don’t mind Yania.” Yoko smiled.

“Okay. That will be a couple of minute’s girls. I’ll get Mike working on it right away. It’s nice to have you two bright young ladies back again.” Yania smiled and left their table.

“Thank you Yania.” Yoko smiled thanking her as she slithered away and into the kitchen to help Mike. Yoko looked back to Sala and looked just in time to notice Sala starring at her, which made her feel more than a little uncomfortable.

“Hey Sala are you okay?” Yoko asked her friend more than a little worried about her. Sala blinked and shook her head as if she were waking herself up.

“Y… yeah, I’m fine. Just more tired than I thought. Sorry for starring, Yoko. I was just sort of spacing out I guess.” Sala apologized sounding just a bit nervous and blushing again. Again, Yoko was not totally convinced that Sala was telling her the full truth.

“Sala if something is wrong tell me. Maybe I can help?” Yoko suggested offering her help with whatever seemed to be distracting the Naga. She also noticed how Sala’s eyes seemed to flare with a bit of that same look that she got from the other Nagas before it was quickly replaced with a bit of guilt as Sala shook her head.

“No, it’s alright Yoko. Uh, I’ll be right back. I need to wash my hands from the materials I was working with back in the lab.” Sala said getting up and quickly excusing herself from the table and making a quick break for the bathroom.

Yoko watched Sala leave and felt bad for her, she knew Sala well enough that she knew something was bothering her. She sat there debating whether she should stay there at the table or go follow Sala and see if she was all right.
155332111.title: The Pizzeria

1553321111.content:
Yoko eventually decided upon staying there and waiting for Sala to return. Giving her plenty of time to think about the day’s events and how she ended up once again running for her life from those few nagas that wanted to eat Yoko for their own amusement. It had been a normal enough day as far as it could be called normal for a girl her age living and studying at NU. Waking up and heading to class with her closest friend and roommate Faith, her other naga friend who was almost like a sister to Yoko having pretty much grown up with her since they were both little kids. Her first class was fairly uneventful, sure she got the customary stares and jokes from the other nagas in the class as her, but for the most part nothing happened and her day was fairly uneventful until she got to fifth period.

During fifth period, the instructor after going over the lesson for the day left the students to study on their own for the remainder of the class while they went to meeting with another teacher. Which left Yoko and the other human students in the class alone and was where all the trouble began as she already was getting many stares from the other nagas of the class, especially from her nemesis, Sam. The Hydra-naga with three upper torsos on a single snake like body and as soon as the instructor left Hydra had made it a point to go ahead and try to capture Yoko and eat her. Luckily for Yoko she always choose the desk closest to the front and closest to the door, so when she saw Sam coming for her she quickly bolted. Knowing that nothing good would ever come of her coming to her and already guessing by the look on Sam’s face what her intentions were.

After that, it was a lengthy chase across the campus grounds with Sam always on her, never far behind. If Yoko had anything going for her, it was her small, quick and lithe body that eventually allowed her to pull out and ahead of Sam and disappear from her site long enough to find Sala and convince Sala to hide her. Replaying the scenes of the chase across the school ground Yoko only sighed heavily as she let her head fall onto the table with an audible. *thunk!*

"What's the matter hon? Long day?" Yania asked with a warm concerned smile as she held both of the pizzas in her hands. Yoko looked up at Yania and nodded her head with a frown as she moved her head to let Yania set the food down.

"Yeah, just the usual of running around being chased and trying to remain uneaten." Yoko said, as the both plates were placed down on the table nice and hot.

"I take it it's the same naga that normally chases you around?" Yania asked still standing beside the table listening to Yoko.

"Yep, I never seem to get a break with her. I mean if she isn't trying to eat me one moment she's simply waiting to do so the next!" Yoko said rolling her eyes and cutting off a slice of pizza for herself knowing that Sala would likely eat the other one all on her own when she got back.

"I see," Yania said placing her hand to her chin as she coiled her tail under her and sat on it like a chair of sorts. "I know it's not much but I would suggest staying close to your friends when dealing with her. After all it's better to face your enemies with friends then to do so alone." Yania said as Sala came back from the bathroom, she looked the same though Yoko sensed that she was not exactly acting her normal self. "Ah, you've come back to join us!" Yania joked with a smile as Sala smiled back and sat at the table.

"Yep, I smelled yours and Mikes cooking and I couldn't resist coming to try it out." Sala laughed, as she easily took several slices and easily gulped them down, a little more faster and eagerly then she normally would. Sort of as if she were trying to fill a hole in her stomach that just did not seem to want to be filled.

"Well you should stop by more often than. We'll gladly cook you up some fresh pizza any day." Yania smiled and sat up off her tail and twisted a little. "Okay ladies I better go check on Mike and make sure he doesn't burn anything." She said with a wistful smile and from the back of the building, a guy’s voice could be heard as Mike yelled "I heard that!" Which made the two girls giggle while Yania only smiled and shook her head and excused herself.
1553321111.title: Small Talk

15533211111.content:
Both Yoko and Sala ate in relative silence while eating. Sala quickly ate her pizza in a few minutes and slowed down when she got to the pizza she was sharing with Yoko. Only eating as fast as she was, pacing herself so they could enjoy their food. Or enjoy it as long as they could until another naga came into the building, a familiar three headed naga known as Hydra. Yoko immediately starred at her and looked at Sala and gently tapped her belly scales with a foot and looked in Hydras direction nodding her head. While the three-headed naga looked through the restaurant and her eyes rested on Yoko a smirk came to her middle head as she made her way over to Yoko.

Sala at the kick from Yoko and noticing where her friend was starring looked over and saw Hydra coming towards them both, eyes locked on Yoko and not her, yet. With a frown, Sala got up, moved between Yoko and Hydra, and stood at her full eight feet of height as she glared at the central head, Sam. The brain behind the whole being that was Hydra and the one most responsible for making Yoko's days a living hell. "Stop right there Sam, you know the rules of this restaurant. No eating any of the guests, EVER. And it applies to you as well." Sala said icily already prepared for a confrontation with the younger naga.

"So you say." Sam said crossing her arms as her two side heads looked around with their own joined bodies. Molly, the one to Sam’s right, was looking around at the restaurant and at the menu. While Katie, the one to Sam’s left, looked up Sala and over to Yoko and at the other people around in the restaurant, which was pretty much no one else at this hour.

"And so it is. Rules are there for a reason, Sam." Sala hissed at the smaller eyes never letting the other naga out of her sites, nor any part of her body. "No matter how much you think they don't apply to you."

Sam only smiled, laughed, and shook her head. "For one who is so smart you sure are stupid, red. I didn't come here to eat anyone in the first place. I just came here to get some pizza with my sisters and tell a friend how much I can't wait to see her tomorrow, right girls?" Sam said looking to her two other halves.

"Yep, just looking for something to eat." Molly said looking to Sala and Yoko and smiling before returning to staring at the menu.

"Hi there!" Katie waved to Sala and Yoko as she giggled happily, aloof of the fact that her center sister was just leading them along.

"See? Now why not be a good red head and let me and my sisters be? We're really hungry and would like to get something to eat." Sam said with a devious grin that only made Sala glare harder at her.

"Fine, but you can go around our table and talk to her with me nearby." Sala said relenting. Not because she wanted to, but because she had no cause to threaten or harm Sam as she was not verbally threatening to eat Yoko. Although she was highly suspicious of her motives no matter what her intentions were. She moved aside for Hydra to move towards the counter, though she did stop close to their table and Sam looked over to Yoko and smiled.

"Hello Yoko, we missed you earlier." Sam said as she stared at the human girl across the table from her, while Sala stayed close beside her friend, ready to intervene on a moment’s notice.

"Yeah of course you did." Only missed the chance to eat me you mean! Yoko said and thought to herself. She did not trust same one bit and would have preferred that she had never come to the pizzeria. Now she would be unable to eat in peace, constantly having to worry about Sam trying to eat her in some way.

"Hopefully we can have a chance to talk together tomorrow, wouldn't that be nice? We haven't had much time to talk together alone, you and I." Sam said sounding hurt. The reason mostly being because Yoko either managed to run into Sala and disappear or somehow some way finding an excuse to leave her classes just a moment earlier than everyone else to get away from Sam and reunite with Faith.

"Yeah sure. But I'll more than likely be too busy to talk with you so please don't hold your breath on my account." Yoko said wishing that Sam would just hurry and leave them alone.

"Oh, hello there. What can I do for you three ladies?" Asked Yania interrupting the little discussion between Hydra and Yoko. The older naga smiled at the three of them as they all turned to look at her smiling face. "Well? What'll you be havin? If you'll take a seat I'll go ahead and take your orders." She smiled and with the end of her tail pulled Hydra away from Yoko and Sala's table to an empty one several tables away.

Yoko sighed as she watched Yania lead Hydra away from her and Sala and looked up at her larger naga friend concerned. Sala, being the nearly always-overprotective naga she was of Yoko was almost close to baring her four hidden fangs that she always kept recessed inside her mouth. At least she normally did unless she intended to use them in a fight or whatever reason she normally used them for that she had not yet told her about yet. Yoko reached up and placed a hand on Salas arm and tugged on it twice to get her attention, which she did as Sala quickly blinked and looked down to Yoko.

"Hey Sala I can’t eat anymore. What say we package the rest and bring it with us? After all I did tell Faith I'd bring her something to eat." Yoko suggested as she looked up to her friends face.

"Okay I'll get a box and we can go. Go ahead and head outside. I'll pay for the meal and get the extra slices." Sala said as Yoko nodded and stood. Sala smiled to Yoko once as she went to the counter and pulled out her wallet from her belt pocket and paid for their meal, while Yoko headed towards the door. Of course doing so with one of Hydra's heads watching her leave and was joined outside shortly after by Sala. From there it was simply a matter of Sala escorting Yoko back to her dorm and back to Faith's care. The two departing and going their separate ways once Yoko was safely away inside her room and Sala went to her own dorm in a different building.
15533211111.title: Confrontation

155332111111.content:
As Yoko entered her dorm room, safe for the night, she was met by her room-mate and best friend Faith. The two of them having been together long enough to know each other as if they were sisters rather than friends. Yoko walked into her dorm living area and saw Faith sitting on the couch, looking at the blank TV screen, she could not tell at first, but she eventually heard a soft sobbing sound and noticed Faith was shaking a little. It was then Yoko realized Faith was crying. Biting her lower lip she walked over to Faith and cautiously placed a hand on Faiths shoulder.

Her friend stifled her crying, she stopped shaking as she put a hand on hers, and very softly said; “Yoko, I thought I lost you today.” She said simply, being short and to the point.

“Yeah, but you didn’t I’m here now, safe and sound because of Sala.” She said giving her shoulders a gentle comforting squeeze as she tried to smile, feeling just as hurt as her friend.

“Maybe today Yoko, but what if she hadn’t been there? What if they had actually caught and eaten you Yoko?!” Faith said and turned around to face her. Her long brown hair that was normally neat and was frizzled and in a mess, her blue eyes staring back at Yoko, piercing her own to look into her. Faith was shaken and worried for her friends’ safety more than anything else in the world. If she could, she would give anything to protect Yoko from the other nagas that sought to capture and toy with her.

“Then I would trust you to tell the dean, or someone we can both trust to help free me, Faith.” Yoko would say and hug her naga friend, hugging her close to her so that their bodies were pressed closely together. “I trust you with my life Faith, I know that should something ever happen to me that you will be able to save me.” Yoko said and gave her a final loving squeeze with her arms before letting her go. Faith still looked down, but she no longer looked like she was or had been crying.

“I wish I could do more than just going to get someone else to help you though.” Faith would say as she sighed and moved around her couch to half wrap Yoko’s waist and guide her to her separate bedroom. Yoko would take the hint and walk with Faith as she slithered with her.

“But Faith, we both know what happens! I’m not trying to say you shouldn’t try to help me, but if something were to happen to me and then you in turn than who is going to help us?” Yoko asked as they came to their two bedrooms, separated by a hallway and two doors.

“I would think of something, but I hate being one of the weakest at the school! It’s so frustrating!” She said exaggerating.

“Hehe, you aren’t the weakest Faith, or have you already discounted how weak I am?” Yoko asked giggling poking Faiths side as her tail let her go. “Besides you are a lot smarter than Sam, we know it and Sam knows it. That’s why she picks on you because you’re smarter than her and she can’t do anything to you without getting in trouble.” Yoko pointed out as Faith was forced to admit she was right.

“Okay, okay I get it. I might not be the weakest but I am certainly not the dumbest that’s for sure.” Faith said with a slight smile, which, in turn made Yoko smile as well.

“Good night Faith, Good night Yoko.” They both said at once hugging once more before turning into their respective bedrooms. Yoko’s was a fairly sparse room, having only a bed under a window and two dressers and a closet, with a small bathroom attached designed for a human rather than a naga like Faith’s was. Yoko would walk over to her bed and strip of her shirt and pants, kicking of her shoes and socks, letting them lie where they fell as she walked into the bathroom to wash up. Tossing her undergarments out to the bedroom as she took her shower and got ready for bed by dressing in a nightie with new clean under garments and crawled into her warm bed, covered in the warm blankets, closing her eyes as she let sleep take her so that the woes and troubles of the world were far behind her.
155332111111.title: The Faith of Friendship
